review: Prime video streaming became relevant to me when they got the HBO series. Being able to stream 2 different shows at once (on different devices) is nice. Now the FireTV is training me to choose standard delivery to get $1 video credit. I still need to let the nephews try the FreeTime preview. Being able to access unlimited personal photos on cloud drive is also key, and making the most recent images a screen saver has been really nice. Access to AmazonMusic and Prime playlists is ok, just not a selling point to me. The games (and ridiculously backordered game controller) are a selling point. But the ~5gb of usable storage is not adequate for a game machine. I think my image cache alone chews up over 500mb. They really need to allow expanding the storage with USB; that's my biggest complaint ... not enough storage space. I'd also like the UI to let me remove apps from display, but not the cloud. I'd rather enter some sort of Library view to see everything on the device and in the cloud. I also love that it has a USB port, so I can add a Flirc for infrared and use it with my Harmony remote. Miracast support is an extra bonus. It ended up kicking out an Apple TV, Ouya, and Nexus Player from my TV stand. I'm also really liking the potential of Amazon Echo. I'm assuming they'll integrate the 2, so I can use an Echo in my living room to voice control the FireTV. Also, I'd like to cast Echo music to play through my TV surround sound.

review: The fire tv is a very powerful device however it does not have the cable and network apps that almost every other streaming device on the market does. The customer service has been great though. I can say from experience with the roku, Apple TV, and chomecast that the fire TV has the best customer service. However it has the most limited app availability even though it's processor is very powerful. It's dissappointing that from my cable subscription I can only watch HBO and shotime. On fire TV The only option to watch new TV that I can access on demand through my network is to buy it at 2.99 an episode or unplug The fire TV and stream from my computer.
